rationale: Both the source and target fields have the same name and description, referring to the channel ID with structure depending on the assay type. Therefore, this is an exact match.

The source field 'antibody_name' refers to the name of the antibody targeting a specific molecule, while the target field 'hgnc_symbol' refers to the gene symbol. The source field covers a broader concept by referring to the antibody rather than just the gene symbol.
Both 'rr_id' in the source and 'antibody_rrid' in the target refer to the RRID (unique antibody identifier from the Antibody Registry). They are identical in meaning, so this is an exact match.
Both fields refer to the unique identifier for proteins in the UniProt database. Therefore, this is an exact match.
Both fields describe the lot number, which is specific to the vendor. This is an exact match.

The source field 'dilution' uses a ratio (e.g., 1/200), while the target field 'dilution_factor' is a whole number (e.g., 200). They represent the same concept but in different formats, so this is a close match.
Both fields refer to the catalog number of conjugated antibodies, making this an exact match.
Both fields refer to the name of the entity conjugated to the antibody. This is an exact match.
